page.title: 05FARMING IN CRUWYS MORCHARD 1
page.content: Land is Grade lll or 1V, Culm Measures. In the area covered are 17 holdings, the two largest of 160 and 120 hectares farmed by tenants of the Cruwys estate. The smallest, 2 hectares, a broiler unit, rears 700- 900 thousand birds per year. Owner- occupiers farm the remainder of between 6 and 104 hectares each. The type of farming is similar throughout, dairying and stockrearing. 11 dairy herds, overall total 740 cows give about 5000 litres per cow per year. Milking cows are often crossed with beef bulls. Milk is sold to the Milk Marketing Board who collect from each unit daily. 10 flocks of sheep make a ewe population of about 1600. Store and fat cattle are reared and some corn grown. The latter is mostly barley for consumption by the farmer's own stock.
